page.title: 05Trade
page.content: The area{A2}is served by a First and Middle school having approx 340 children on roll.There are extensive playing field and good recreation facilities.The shopping precinct is similar to allthe other residential areas of Crawley. The shopping precinct contains {A fish and chip {shop,a glazier,a sub-post office, an {iron mongers,a large supermarket, {newsagent and off licence and a public {house.}There are two churches that serve this area they are St. Barnabas and Christ Church .There are some old peoples homes that have been built in the grounds of an old school. The school was called Miton Mount Girls School it was closed in the 1930's. One of the former pupils at this school was {Mary Wilson} the wife of former Labour Prime Minister {Sir {Harold Wilson. }
